content: Please note that if you have shared it with someone, it will become unavailable.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a message that informs users about what will happen to their shared notes when they choose to delete them. It appears in a confirmation dialog and aims to educate users on the consequences of deleting shared content.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'onun istifadə etmək mümkün deyil' is a bit awkward and doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'unavailable.' It literally translates to 'it's not possible to use it.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Nəzərə alın ki, onu kiminləsə paylaşmısınızsa, o əlçatmaz olacaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation is a bit long and could be slightly restructured for better flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Nəzərə alın ki, paylaşdığınız təqdirdə, o əlçatmaz olacaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'die Datei nicht mehr verfügbar ist' (the file is no longer available) is too literal and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'it will become unavailable'. The original sentence refers to the note, not just 'a file'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte beachten Sie, dass diese Notiz nicht mehr verfügbar sein wird, wenn Sie diese mit jemandem geteilt haben.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation contains a grammatical error. The verb 'ես' (yes - I) is incorrectly placed. It should reflect that 'it' (the note) is being shared, not the user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Խնդրում ենք նկատի ունենալ, որ եթե այն կիսվել է ինչ-որ մեկի հետ, այն անհասանելի կդառնա:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '利用できなくなりますのでご注意ください' is a bit formal and indirect for a user-facing message. While technically correct, it might sound overly cautious or bureaucratic. A more natural phrasing would better suit the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 誰かと共有している場合は、アクセスできなくなります。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of 'ので' (node) creates a slightly clunky sentence structure. It's grammatically correct, but less conversational.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 誰かと共有している場合は、アクセスできなくなります。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "사용할 수 없게 되므로, 다른 사람과 공유한 경우 주의하시기 바랍니다." doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'it will become unavailable'. It translates to 'Therefore, please be careful if you have shared it with someone'. It lacks the direct implication of unavailability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 공유한 경우 사용할 수 없게 됩니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean sentence is a bit long and could be more conversational. Consider breaking it up for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 다른 사람과 공유한 경우, 사용할 수 없게 됩니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation, "ມັນຈະກາຍເປັນບໍ່ສາມາດໃຊ້ໄດ້," is a literal translation of "it will become unavailable." A more natural phrasing in Lao would convey the meaning of 'it will no longer be accessible'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ມັນຈະບໍ່ສາມາດເຂົ້າເຣື່ອງໄດ້ອີກ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ມັນຈະກາຍເປັນບໍ່ສາມາດໃຊ້ໄດ້" could be improved with a smoother flow. Consider breaking it down for better readability in Lao.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ມັນຈະບໍ່ສາມາດໃຊ້ໄດ້ອີກຕໍ່ໄປ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'it' is ambiguous. 'it' refers to the note but 'tos' is the accusative plural form. The translation should reflect the singular note being deleted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ņemiet vērā: ja to kopīgojāt ar kādu, tas kļūs nepieejams.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'acesta va deveni indisponibil' is too literal. A more natural Romanian phrasing would convey the unavailability affecting the shared note itself, not just a general 'it'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Rețineți că, dacă l-ați partajat cu cineva, nota va deveni indisponibilă.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "ඔහුට/ඇයට ද අහිමි වන බව කරුණාවෙන් සලකන්න" is too literal and doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'it will become unavailable'.  A more natural translation would focus on the note disappearing for the shared recipient.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ එය බෙදාගත් පුද්ගලයාටද එය නොපෙනෙනු ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of 'ඔහුට/ඇයට' is slightly clunky. It's grammatically correct but less conversational.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replacing 'ඔහුට/ඇයට' with a more general pronoun or rephrasing to avoid the distinction would be preferable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'it will become unavailable' is not perfectly captured by 'stane sa to nedostupným'. A more natural and accurate translation would convey that the note will disappear or be inaccessible to the other person.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Upozorňujeme, že ak ste to s niekým zdieľali, nebude to pre neho/pre ňu dostupné.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Upoštevajte, da ne bo na voljo, če ste to dali v skupno rabo z nekom drugim.' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Please note that if you have shared it with someone, it will become unavailable.' The passive voice isn't effectively conveyed. The pronoun 'to' is ambiguous, and it's unclear what 'it' refers to.  A better translation would highlight the action of the recipient losing access.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Upoštevajte, da je opustila dostopnost, če ste jo dali v skupno rabo z nekom drugim.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, the phrase 'je opustila dostopnost' (literally 'has abandoned accessibility') sounds slightly awkward and unnatural in Slovenian. A more fluent phrasing would improve clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Upoštevajte, da je ne bo več na voljo, če ste jo dali v skupno rabo z nekom drugim.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'постаће недоступно' (postaće nedostupno) literally translates to 'will become unavailable'. While technically correct, it sounds slightly unnatural in Serbian. A more natural phrasing would convey the meaning that the shared note will be removed from the recipient's view.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Имајте на уму да ако то поделите са неким, нестаће за њим.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'postaće nedostupno' is a bit too literal and could be improved for naturalness in Serbian. A more common and natural phrasing would be 'neće biti dostupno'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: neće biti dostupno

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'kullanılamayacağını' (cannot be used) doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'unavailable'. It implies a usability issue rather than simply not being accessible.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bunu birisiyle paylaştıysanız erişilemez hale geleceğini lütfen unutmayın.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "it" refers to the note itself. The Ukrainian translation "елементом" (element) is too generic and doesn't specifically refer to the note. It's also not idiomatic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Зауважте, що якщо ви поділилися цим записом з кимось, він стане недоступним.
